Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk7-scala2.10/655/
Test PASSed (JDK 7 and Scala 2.10).
The dependency thing was my only comment -- even if there are follow ups, it's all super low risk since this is almost all in the test rig. Thanks @benstopford, LGTM!
@ijuma please kindly review the PR. Thanks.

Refer to this link for build results (access rights to CI server needed): 
https://builds.apache.org/job/kafka-pr-jdk8-scala2.12/656/
Test FAILed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.12).

@guozhangwang - your points above - that is the same solution i had in mind. I didn't really want to go down that path due to the overhead of introducing another store, changelog etc, but maybe that is the only way. 
There is also an issue i discovered on KTable/KTable join which means we might need to do something like this anyway - https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4609
Yes, thank you.

w.r.t the `TupleForwarder` bit - the reason it exists at the moment is to avoid duplicating the decision etc of whether `context.forward()` should or shouldn't be called. I don't think this is actually changed by what is suggested, but maybe i'm just not seeing it at the moment. Anyway, i'll have a look and see where we get to

@mjsax, @guozhangwang - i've fixed the issue by materializing the join as G mentioned above. This does mean i'll need to update the KIP to add 2 overloaded methods as we need the Serdes to write to the store.
At the moment i think we either go this way or we remove the KTable/GlobalKTable joins for now. My preference is probably to go with it

@edoardocomar, did you see my question above regarding refreshing of Kerberos tickets?

Hi @ijuma @guozhangwang 
I am new to the codebase and process, so please guide me if I am going wrong somewhere.

I have done a merge from trunk HEAD and tried the following tests on my local setup.
```
./gradlew -PscalaVersion=2.10 test (with JDK1.7)
./gradlew -PscalaVersion=2.11 test (with JDK1.8)
./gradlew -PscalaVersion=2.12 test (with JDK1.8)
```
The tests fail sometimes when run all together but the failing ones pass when run selectively afterwards. May be the tests are non deterministic, or am I missing something?

I will push the trunk HEAD merge to trigger another Jenkins test.

@guozhangwang @enothereska @mjsax - a follow on from https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/2166
It was one of the review comments, but was merged before I'd gotten around to doing the rename

Upgraded Kafka Streams to 0.10.2.0-SNAPSHOT and deployed. Your gut feeling was right, no cluster upgrade was needed. Until now - these last few hours - everithing works fine. I'll monitor how it will behave and keep you posted here.

> 2017-01-10 16:34:29.782  INFO 22720 --- [qtp844326063-55] o.a.kafka.common.utils.AppInfoParser     : Kafka version : 0.10.2.0-SNAPSHOT
2017-01-10 16:34:29.782  INFO 22720 --- [qtp844326063-55] o.a.kafka.common.utils.AppInfoParser     : Kafka commitId : 1fea1c390846673f

Hi @ijuma rebased and included SASL/SCRAM multi-login testing.
Also enhanced the log output of KerberosLogin to be able to distinguish different instances.
We ran the two-consumers test with sleeps and a reduced Kerberos ticket refresh and from the log, it looks OK:

```
[2017-01-10 16:50:04,256] DEBUG Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - It is a Kerberos ticket (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:04,256] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT refresh thread started. (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:04,257] DEBUG Found TGT with client principal 'kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM' and server principal 'krbtgt/EXAMPLE.COM@EXAMPLE.COM'. (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:04,259] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT valid starting at: Tue Jan 10 16:50:04 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:04,259] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT expires: Tue Jan 10 17:00:04 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:04,259] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT refresh sleeping until: Tue Jan 10 16:58:08 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:05,051] DEBUG Principal=client@EXAMPLE.COM - It is a Kerberos ticket (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:05,054] INFO Principal=client@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT refresh thread started. (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:05,054] DEBUG Found TGT with client principal 'client@EXAMPLE.COM' and server principal 'krbtgt/EXAMPLE.COM@EXAMPLE.COM'. (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:05,054] INFO Principal=client@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT valid starting at: Tue Jan 10 16:50:05 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:05,054] INFO Principal=client@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT expires: Tue Jan 10 17:00:05 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:50:05,055] INFO Principal=client@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT refresh sleeping until: Tue Jan 10 16:58:10 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)

[2017-01-10 16:58:08,624] DEBUG Found TGT with client principal 'kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM' and server principal 'krbtgt/EXAMPLE.COM@EXAMPLE.COM'. (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:58:08,624] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT valid starting at: Tue Jan 10 16:58:08 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:58:08,624] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT expires: Tue Jan 10 17:08:08 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
[2017-01-10 16:58:08,624] INFO Principal=kafka/localhost@EXAMPLE.COM - TGT refresh sleeping until: Tue Jan 10 17:06:22 GMT 2017 (org.apache.kafka.common.security.kerberos.KerberosLogin)
```

LGTM, merged to trunk, thanks!

I posted an update with a lot of fixes.  I still need to address:
* Brokers should not send ApiVersionsRequest
* Implement pre-KIP-74 message-too-big behavior
* More centralized handling of versionMismatch exception
* some other stuff
